text:
Great Place! Service too be improved!

The restaurant that turns into a night club is big and very modern. The place is actually quite impressive when you first walk-in. For the summer time, it has a big terrasse - can't wait to try out the place this summer, it must be amazing. 

Food wise, to my surprise. My salmon tartare was too die for - I am a fan of salmon tartare and this one was the best one I had in my life, I'm being serious. I really thought that there food was going to be basic but they caught me by surprise and I left very impressed.

Therefore, when my waitress brought me my cocktail glass with a hair in it.. really.. 

Overall, I will go back for the food and I'll be checking into my glass just in case..

Nous y sommes allés avec un groupe de collègues pour un 5 a7, suivi d'un souper et d'un peu de danse. Mercredi c'est soirée latine au Fogo et j'étais curieuse de l'essayer. 
Il faisait très chaud et nous avons pu tester la belle terrasse. Conformément aux autres commentaires, la terrasse est belle et grande. Conformément aux autres commentaires également, le service n'était pas au top et il a fallu courir après les serveuses à certains moments et à d'autres elles étaient un peu pressantes pour nous faire consommer. A 19.01 quand nous avons voulu commander un dernier 'special du 5 a 7' on nous a dit trop tard... pas très commerçant.
Nous ne nous sommes pas arrêtés a cela, décidés à passer une bonne soirée. Nous avons commandé des entrées, certaines étaient bien assez conséquentes pour faire un plat (la poutine ou l'ensemble de 3 saucisses par ex). Et certains ont continué avec des plats. Principalement des mets portugais, les copains étaient contents de leur sélection et la bouffe était bonne et bien présentée.
Après nous avons pu profiter du groupe de musique latine qui jouait ce soir là. Belle ambiance, plusieurs couples venus se pratiquer a la salsa, d'autres comme nous qui préféraient danser sans règles précises.
On a passé une bonne soirée, j'irai plutôt en groupe qu'en famille et pas pour une date.

Belle soirée des dames en ce jeudi. 
J'ai pu profiter d'une promo; le vin au verre (un choix seulement) à prix réduit pour le 5 à 7 et ensuite avec un repas de 28$ et plus, on obtient un choix de cocktail à 2$!
En plus, on a eu droit à un chanteur sur la terrasse. Plutôt sympa et toute une ambiance! 
Le personnel est très accueillant est sympathique mais le service tend à être lent, voir absent, plus la soirée avance. 

Côté plat, j'ai vraiment apprécié les calmars frits avec ses 2 sauces maison. J'ai de loin préféré la sauce cocktail. La mayo épicée malheureusement n'avait pas de goût. La présentation est originale et ils étaient parfaitement cuits. La panure est croustillante et les graines de pavot ajoutent un goût et une texture intéressantes. La tranche de citron trempée dans le sésame est aussi une idée originale et est visuellement attrayante bien qu'un peu salissante. 
Les tartares étaient bons sans plus. Le tartare de thon était bien assaisonné mais le choix des ingrédients manquent de textures et d'originalité. Le tartare de saumon était quant à lui très fade et aussi peu inspiré. Les frites quand à elles étaient bonnes mais molles et huileuses. 
En somme, ce fût une belle soirée. Je trouve le menu cher pour ce que c'est mais j'ai apprécié l'atmosphère sur la terrasse. Je reviendrais pour l'apéro et cocktails avec les copines un soir de ladies night.

Came here with a group of four, it was ladies night so that means 50% off ur appetizers meal and dessert, plus it was 5-7 so got 5 dollar drinks as well.

The place is gorgeous and huge! They have wonderful little booths that were red couches I really wanted to sit there as it looked very cozzy but the hostess informed me it was for people who reserved ahead of time... ( I was there 2 hours nobody was seated in those booths not one person) they have a great huge outdoor space but since it was to cold still wasn't open. There was a bday party in the bar section, so many people that were blocking the way to the bathroom over 30 they did not care at all it was like pushing through a packed escalator. They should have been seated or out the way it was to much.

Service wasn't the greatest I had about 6-7 different People coming To our table so it got a bit confusing as to who was our waitress. The drink specials didn't include the peachtini which sucked because that was the first drink we ordered. Then after hearing that rum, gin, vodka all rail booze was on sale I decided to get jack and coke only to realize it wasn't part of the deal... I had to ask and she knew I thought it was part of the deal so a bit sneaky but I switched to rum after. Always nice to have that happen when you're out spending with your friends. Also noticed out waitress was drinking with a table with two men not sure if that was the owner but not cool if I'm trying to get your attention to switch an order or ask for a glass of water!

Food was good, my fondue wasn't anything out of this world because the bread was way to fresh and soft, usually with fondue you would use harder bread or even cracker like toast chips so it would
Go well together. I added pepper to bring it all together. My chicken salad was interesting... the chicken I thought was gonna be a breast with skin and crispy but it was a breast just a regular breast no spices. The salad was good it's self. I tried the bavette it was great the sauce they used and veggies were cooked well. Calamari was greasy a bit with barely any calamari. 

I would come back I loved the place it's self. Service needs to be worked on, staff needs to be better trained. Menu princes are a bit ridiculous for what it is, it's so far out of town, I thought it would be cheaper.I saved a big -17.90 off my bill of over 200 something. They need to put a drink menu with what's on sale that way you don't get tricked and have to spend more like we did. Other then that it's a great spot check it out.

Decided to come here as my friend had been a few years ago and recommended it. Figured we would be in the area and looked like a decent spot to check out. First i started with the peachtini which was 12$ and tiny, not worth it. They had 4 to 7 deals on drinks, certain drinks were 5$. However, she didn't mention jack and coke wasn't on special and kind of tricked us rather than letting us after the second one. For food, started with the asiago calamari, which was nothing special, the calamari was overcooked and hard. The beef tartar was absolutely delicious I would go back just to have that again. Then we had a wood oven pizza, called "La Cochonette", topped with bacon, pancetta and goat cheese. That was also very good. I would've given this place 4 stars, but because of the service unfortunately i had to leave 3. The staff was not very well trained, our waitress was on her cellphone half the time when we were waiting to order. Very disorganised, had a bunch of different people serve us which was extremely confusing. I would go back for the beef tartar only if i was in the area, wouldn't go out of my way to eat here though.
